results.title: Return of the sea elephant
results.creator_credit: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Churchill Films and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
On the island of Guadalupe, 130 miles off the west coast of Mexico, there is a colony of unique aquatic mammals, the nosed sea elephants. On this trip, Cousteau and the crew of the Calypso examine the habits of these unusual animals and try to gather information as to the size of the herd, whether new colonies are forming and where they go in their seven months at sea. With Jacques Cousteau and narrated by Rod Serling.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Churchill Films and Wolper Productions

results.title: Beneath the frozen world
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
The Jacques Cousteau team photograph underwater the life and iceforms of Antarctica, during its brief summer. Suitable for Upper Primary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: The Singing whale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
The Cousteau team makes use of modern underwater recording devices to tape the melodic sounds of the humpback whale, and examine the possibility of a communication system.

results.title: 500 million years beneath the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Jacques Cousteau and his divers survey the 500 million years of life beneath the sea and explain how man’s exploitation of the natural resources of the coastal zones of the world are jeopardising this life.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
Jacques Cousteau and his divers survey the 500 million years of life beneath the sea and explain how man’s exploitation of the natural resources of the coastal zones of the world are jeopardising this life.

results.title: Trial at Nuremberg
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin, CBS News and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”
Narrated by Walter Cronkite, this newsreel film shows parts of the trials at Nuremberg between October 1945 and August 1946. During the trials some Russian made film of German atrocities was shown. This is included as is also film giving the background to the trial.

results.title: Movies learn to talk
results.creator_credit: Burton Benjamin, Kenco Films, Columbia Broadcasting System and Prudential Insurance Company of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Traces the development of sound movies from early experiments with clumsy systems at the turn of the century to “The Jazz Singer” in 1927 and the polished and sophisticated sound film of today. Includes glimpses of film personalities and excerpts from silent and sound movies. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Goering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Goering’s life story. The air race of 1918; exile in Sweden; return to Germany and the early days of Nazism; Goering sets up the storm troops, the Gestapo, the Luftwaffe, is largely responsible for the economic revival of Germany and wins immense popular prestige. Early Luftwaffe triumphs are eclipsed by the failure of operation Sea Lion and the RAAF raids on Germany. Goering falls from power and public prestige to a figurehead. His capture, trial and sentence at Nuremberg.

results.title: Lenin and Trotsky
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Shows how Lenin and Trotsky made possible the seizure of the Russian Government and the consolidation of Communist power in the USSR, and how Lenin became a Communist hero, while Trotsky became the arch-enemy. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Dust bowl
results.creator_credit: Mel Stuart, Burton Benjamin and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Contrasts past and present conditions of the Dust Bowl area of the Southern Great Plains. Provides newsreel footage of the area during the dust storms period of the early 1930s. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.
